perturbation.original_text: Kubient shall use reasonable efforts to provide to Customer the Services. Customer agrees to provide all reasonable and necessary access, support and cooperation for Kubient to provide the Services in a timely and effective manner.
perturbation.changed_text: Kubient will endeavor to provide the Services to Customer. Customer agrees to provide access, support, and cooperation for Kubient to provide the Services.
perturbation.explanation: By replacing 'shall use reasonable efforts' with 'will endeavor' and removing 'reasonable and necessary', the obligation on Kubient and the Customer becomes less defined. 'Endeavor' is subjective, and the removal of the qualifier 'reasonable and necessary' means the extent of access, support, and cooperation required is undefined.
perturbation.contradicted_law: General contract law requires specificity in obligations. Vague obligations are difficult to enforce, potentially leading to a breach of contract claim.

perturbation.original_text: Customer will comply with all international, federal, state and local laws, rules, and regulations of any governmental or regulating authority ("Law") that are applicable to its business and use of the Service. Customer agrees that it will not transfer or (unless expressly and specifically approved by Kubient in advance and in writing) allow third-party access to the Service.
perturbation.changed_text: Customer will attempt to comply with all laws applicable to its business and use of the Service. Customer may allow third-party access to the Service unless otherwise notified by Kubient.
perturbation.explanation: Replacing 'will comply' with 'will attempt to comply' weakens the obligation. Additionally, reversing the condition for allowing third-party access shifts the burden of preventing it onto Kubient, creating ambiguity about acceptable use.
perturbation.contradicted_law: General contract law principles regarding the duty of good faith and fair dealing. A party cannot contractually agree to comply with all applicable laws and then only 'attempt' to do so.

perturbation.original_text: (iii) the collection, maintenance, management and storage of visitor information (data), to the extent collected, directed by, maintained or stored by Kubient, as well as the performance of the Auction Platform, is and shall be in a secure manner using best practices of security technology and best practices to protect against loss, misuse or alteration of data and Kubient shall use measures in accordance with industry standards to ensure that all databases shall be accessible only by certain authorized personnel of Kubient or Customer;
perturbation.changed_text: (iii) the collection, maintenance, management, and storage of visitor information (data), to the extent collected, directed by, maintained, or stored by Kubient, as well as the performance of the Auction Platform, will be handled in a secure manner. Kubient will take steps to ensure that databases are accessible by personnel.
perturbation.explanation: Removing the requirement for 'best practices of security technology' and 'industry standards' for data security makes the obligation vague. The deletion of 'only certain authorized personnel of Kubient or Customer' weakens authorized access.
perturbation.contradicted_law: CCPA and GDPR require specific security measures for data protection. Removing the requirement to adhere to best practices and industry standards introduces non-compliance and liability for data breaches.
